comment: He is not a bad professor at all. Lectures can be boring, but he is passionate about the subject. Attendance is mandatory, unfortunately (with no dropped grades if you miss class). Also, there are group assignments on random days. If you miss them, you can make it up, but you will only receive up to 50% credit, no exceptions. Tests are pretty easy.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: Just dont do it. Study guides are 5 questions long. Lectures are boring and attendance is required. No extra credit. Ahh yes group assignments are a pain. Doesn't keep your attention during class, you might fall asleep fast. Most of the exams people fail and he doesn't care, also he goes over exams for 5 seconds and thats it.
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy

comment: He's not bad BUT he's very boring. He takes attendance and does in-class assignments randomly. Read the textbook on subjects that is confusing,  pay close attention to the subjects in class and record his lectures in class with a voice note taking app in case there are days you really can't pay attention.Homework & quizzes are online
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I'm currently taking his lecture class and he's really nice but it is a VERY boring class and can be hard to focus if you're not into ecology that much. The textbook, quizzes and homework is online BUT he takes attendance and has group in-class assignments randomly. LOTS of reading and tests can be hard. Is somewhat like a statistics class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Had him for ecology lab which made this class very easy. He is an easy grader and never makes the assignments harder than they should be. Obviously wants everyone to succeed as he even lets you argue for points back when grades come out. Super nice guy.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I took him for Ecology Lab, this class is insanely easy. He's super nice and laid back. The assignments are pretty boring but they're very easy. The worst part of the class is that you have to work in a group most of the time but this can be to your advantage. Labs are also out about an hour and a half to 2 hours early almost every time. Great prof
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Weand's ecology lab was an easy A. He doesn't make it harder than it needs to be AT ALL. Our labs were fun too! Basically all you are graded on are 9 lab reports, no tests, no quizzes, just easy lab reports done in groups. If you need any help on them, he is also very quick to help out :) he's awesome, super cool and chill guy.
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Definitely one of the harder professors that I have ever had. The tests cover an insane amount of material per test. Also, the level of knowlege that you need for the tests is absolutely crazy. If you are not 100% sure of the material down to the finest level possible you will not do good on the tests. He also grades hard for the 4 group assignment
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Definitely made tests much more difficult than they needed to be. He also was a very tough grader on group assignments, and participation points were graded on accuracy rather than participation. Most of the class had a  failing average, and he made things very difficult. Not a bad professor, just very tough so be prepared to put in a lot of work.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: This class is super test heavy. The content was very dense and the tests had so much jammed into them that it was hard to be able to properly understand everything we needed to know. The lectures can be pretty boring as well, so just a heads up
rating_tags: Test heavy

comment: Do not take him if you want to pass your class. Test are very hard and in person. You must come to class for credit points. Class is only lectures that can get boring. And he doesnâ€™t care that more than half my class was failing.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: He was a very nice guy and easy to reach but the way the classroom was run hurt a lot of his students. Very PowerPoint and lecture heavy, 4 tests, homework, and occasional in-class assignments are your whole grade. Take LOTS of notes and take pictures of the review questions from the slides and kahoots as they will be on the test.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: This class was like the bread and butter of science so we never learned any topic in too much detail but I thought the lectures were decent. People didn't do too well on the first test (me included) and he gave extra credit questions on the second test and every test after that. Material was basically stuff from high school so it wasn't bad
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I loved science before this class + would get mainly A's in previous science classes. This class made me dread science, I thought I would actually fail and that I would lose my scholarship over it. They skim over their powerpoint slides, barely explain, don't listen to students + its heavily reflected in test grades. I would avoid this whole course
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Wouldn't take him. He goes through notes extremely to fast, test are really hard, and doesn't care about his student. At least in my case because we had 200+.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Thought ecology would be one of my easier bio courses, but w/ Weand it's unnecessarily difficult. LOTS of content to study/learn that gets quite tedious (like 80 ppt slides for just one lecture) Exams are difficult with SO much content, v hard to study for, but exams did have a *small* curve. Only graded on hw & 4 exams (none are dropped).
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Great lab professor. Answers any questions and is very clear on how to do the labs and lab reports. I made 100s on every lab report. Love him
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Do not recommend the summer class unless this is the only class you are taking. It requires a lot of study time. The test are not easy if you don't study. There are 4 exams, every two weeks there is an exam, no final and does not give extra credit. Has discussion questions that make you feel like you are in English class, grades it based on rubric.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This professor is pretty straight forward on what he is looking for in content to grade. I would def take him again for Lab.

He is a good professor, he is just super passionate about ecology and evolution. His exams are similar to MasteringBiology questions. Uses iclicker for participation. Yet, he might change that since some people abused the system. Study guide doesn't really help for tests. Lowkey taught myself the semester.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Weand is a very concise and straight-to-the-point instructor. He goes through every slide in detail that you would have to know for the exams. His tests are very difficult if you do not show up to class or do not study, but he does curve slightly for exams. As long as you put in the effort, you'll make an A or high B.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Test are extremely difficult. Does give study guides but they are not helpful . Read the textbook and do mastering bio !
rating_tags: Participation matters--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This class was more challenging than others. Must look at a lot of resources in order to do well on the exams. He is a good teacher but just be prepared to work for your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Weand was one of my favorite Professors at KSU. He is dedicated to helping his students succeed. Participation is graded so you dont want to miss out on class. Textbook is not mandatory since test and quiz material come straight from the powerpoints. Exams can be tough but do-able. Quizzes will help a lot so make sure you study them.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Biology 1108 is very fast-paced so be prepared to read and utilize the mastering quizzes to the full. 5 exams and prior to each are chapter quizzes. No cumulative final exam. Attendance is via in-class participation using iclickers. He explains concepts well when they are on topics he loves, like ecology. Physiology you should look elsewhere.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: For the summer, you will double the work of a regular semester. If you take over the summer, make sure you have five hours per day to study and do homework. Tests are crazy hard. Ruined my summer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This class is really difficult and the summer version is NOT condensed. You cover double the material. Tests are next to impossible. Tough class to pass. Much more difficult that bio1107.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He's a pretty good lecturer and explains the curriculum well, but he's SPECIFIC. He makes you work for your grades. If you don't study, you won't do well in this class. All the info on the tests comes from the lectures, but reading the textbook helps, though it isn't required. 5 tests (no cumulative final), with online quizzes and participation.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Difficult summer class: class is the full material stuffed into 2 months. Must know 1 chapter in 3 days and a test almost every week. Super difficult exams that will make you cry. Best taken regular semester as summer will keep your head in the books 24 hours a day,.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Took Weand for Evolution and this guy rocks! There are 4 exams (the final isn't cumulative), and one independent semester paper that can really boost your average. He's pretty laid back during class, and he puts all powerpoints online so the textbook isn't necessary. He responds to emails really quickly and is super willing to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Would take again

comment: You can get a good grade in the class if you attend every lecture. The material on the test is from the PowerPoint. The book is optional. He also provide a lot of extra credit, so that can help you improve your grade.

He's really great in lecture but as soon as you try to approach him, Dr. Weand comes off as very condescending and standoffish. He clearly doesn't care for students. But otherwise, the class itself was super straightforward. He posts powerpounrs online and the book is actually very helpful.
He also gives ALOT  of extra credit on every test. I got a C on one test and his extra credit brought me up to a B.  Just make sure you study so you can have a solid good grade with the extra credit

He only grades off of a few test and attendance. Do  exceptional on the first tests to have a solid grade in the class. IF you want an A, you have to study  in advance because he tests over many chapters of last of information. HE gives study guides and the answers are found on the exams - you just have to fill them out yourself. office hours helps
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's a great lecturer. This class has 5 tests and the final is not a final it's just the last test. He gives a study guide for every test
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: He's a great professor! His lectures are really good. He gives a study guide that tells you what to know for the test. Book isn't required but it's good to have for studying. 5 exams. Final is not cumulative. His test are difficult but do the study guide and MasteringBiology practice questions and you'll do fine on the test.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: This class consists of 5 tests and 25 attendance points. So if you don't do well on the tests you have no chance of passing. Lectures are good, but I'm pretty sure his tests do not equal to the powerpoint lectures. Tests are extremely difficult and his study guides won't guarantee a good grade on the test.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He discourages learning. His tests do not reflect his lecture content. He has poor interpersonal skills and zero compassion. I will NEVER take him again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Weand is both knowledgeable and an excellent teacher--a rare combination at KSU. Use of a textbook is optional, but he draws some of his test questions from Mastering Biology. His tests not only require your knowledge of the material but also require critical thinking. Not an easy A, but you will fully understand the material at the end.
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Not the best bio professor. Lectures and powerpoints are vague. There is nothing on the test what he teaches in the class or what is in the powerpoint. 4 tough tests, one paper and no book (which makes this class even harder).
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's a good teacher, but sometimes his test questions were confusing and harder than they should have been. No text book and PowerPoint slides are kinda vague so you need to go to class. I found the best way to study was to record the lectures. 4 tests, noncumulative final, and a paper.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He really knows his stuff and makes it fun! There were five tests and he is willing to work with the class if the average is lower than it should be. His lectures are really interesting but the class goes by fast so take good notes or record the lectures to study off of. Pay attention in class and fill out the study guide and you will do alright.
Lectures are boring and he isn't willing to offer additional assignments because he's to "busy".

Dr. Weand is a good professor. The best part is that he actually knows the material but the downside is that his exams are tough. Try to do your best on the first 3 exams because the last 2 are the hardest! I would study for weeks prior to his exams and still not receive the grade I was expecting. Get ready to study all the time.
Great teacher, tests are tough and if i wasnt so into biology I would not have recieved and A in the class

This was an upper level course so it is not meant to be easily, especially if you are a BIO major, but Dr. Weand is more than willingly to help you if you show you want the help. You do have to study for his exams because they are a nice amount of short answer questions. Him makes you think but helps you understand the material. HE LOVES ECOLOGY

Loves teaching and loves biology, I really enjoyed his course. Easy to contact with any questions and nice about everything. Book is unnecessary if you attend lecture, which is 5% of your grade anyways and powerpoints and exam reviews are online.

This is the first semester Weand is teaching an SPSU Hitch Hikers class that we all have to take. The class is super easy regardless of who you take, but he is extremely easy. He's so laid back, super cool, and is easy to understand. Rarely any homework and the homework you do have is trivial. But do it, since it's worth almost your whole grade.

Took this class as transient over the summer. Class was only tests, quizzes, and lab. All pretty simple. The test material comes straight from powerpoint and he gives a study guide. Test does have short answer but he hints the topics before hand. Definitely a doable A! Would take him again!

GREAT professor and if you dont pass it is truly all your fault! He post powerpoints so the book isnt needed bc he pulls everything from there, but if you arent great in BIO you may want the book. He is very clear in his teaching and test are simple if you actually study for them, if not then they can be a little hard. I wish he taught more classes

Very clear and organized. Listens to his students and makes sure you understand. Powerpoints online, but a slide or two may occasionally be missing that was in class. Write down what he emphasizes that isn't on the slides. Test straight from lectures, no curveballs. Definitely would take again.
Dr. Weand does another fine job. I think he may have graded harder for this class, but hey, were seniors, get over it. I would take any class Dr. Weand offers, as you will come to enjoy it.

Great Professor. I love biology but if you dont then he will keep you interested. all it takes is studying a few hours out of the week. Very clear and you can come out with a good grade if you put the time and effort into it

A great professor. Very clear and helpful. This class has a lot of ecology and plant stuff in it which he is very passionate about (he is a botanist after all). His tests are straight out of the ppts and lectures. The ppts are not enough though so write down what he says that's not on the slides. Answer study guide ?s and participate and class.

Exceptional Professor. Clear lectures. Gives the power points. Tests follow lecture. Grading is very fair. You will receive an A if you come to class and study the way you should for biology. I had for 2nd semester of general Biology. Great guy.

Weand was new, very nervous. PowerPoint lecture style. Simple, but boring. He was fairly organized, however one down side to his course, was that he did not post the lecture slides. Notes were nearly impossible to take at the speed of the presentation, so having a textbook and attending class was crucial. Not the best, but manageable.

Really good professor. Explains everything in class very well and is willing to help. No homework but you WILL need to study. Tests are hard but he gives you a study guide. As long as you study and show up you will pass.

Mr. Weand is AMAZING!! The best professor I have had so far. Explains material clearly, tests are consistent in difficulty, class powerpoints, study guides and grades all available on vista in a timely manner.

He's a great professor and takes the time to make sure everyone understands. Well organized, very clear, and very knowledgeable. Everything goes well if you stay on top of studying. If you ask a question, he'll help you through it to make you think, so you'll get a better understanding. RECOMMENDED!

I had Weand for both bio sections sections and I received a 99 on the first final and 100 on the second final. Everything on the test is in the book. Read the book thoroughly, memorize the vocab, and do the study guides for the test and you can get virtually every single question correct on his exams. Seriously easy if you study at all.
New teacher. Well organized. Listens to complaints and tries to fix them. Not much homework and all quizzes are online. Exams are a bit tough though.
